text: Psalm 56
Prayer for Deliverance and Confidence in God
For the \add music\add* director, according to The Silent Dove of Distant \add Lands\add*.
Of David. A miktam.
When \add the\add* Philistines seized him in Gath.\f + \fr Ps 56 \ft The Hebrew Bible counts the superscription as the first verse of the psalm; the English verse number is reduced by one \f*
Be gracious to me, O God, because humankind has trampled me;
fighting all the day he oppresses me.
My enemies\f + \fr 56:2 \ft Or “lurking foes” \f* trample all day,
because many \add are\add* attacking me proudly.
⸤When⸥\f + \fr 56:3 \ft Literally “\fq The \ft day” \f* I fear, I trust you.
God, whose word I praise,
God I trust; I do not fear.
What can \add mere\add* flesh do to me?
All day they twist my words;
all their thoughts \add are\add* against me for evil.
They attack,\f + \fr 56:6 \ft Or “they stir up strife” \f* they hide, they watch my ⸤steps⸥,\f + \fr 56:6 \ft Literally “heels” \f*
as they \add lie in\add* wait for my life.
Because of iniquity will they escape?
In anger cast down \add the\add* peoples, O God.
You have kept count of my wonderings.
Put my tears in your bottle;
\add are they\add* not in your book?
Then my enemies will turn back ⸤when⸥\f + \fr 56:9 \ft Literally “in the day” \f* I call.\f + \fr 56:9 \ft i.e., call on God \f*
This I know because\f + \fr 56:9 \ft Or “that” \f* God \add is\add* for me.
God, \add whose\add* word I praise,
Yahweh, \add whose\add* word I praise,
God I trust; I do not fear.
What can \add mere\add* humankind do to me?
\add My\add* vows \add to you\add*, O God, \add are binding\add* upon me.
I will pay thank offerings to you,
because you have delivered my soul from death.
\add Have you\add* not \add kept\add* my feet from stumbling,
that I may walk before God
in the light of the living?
